s.text: According to the mythology, Coppola was given third-rate scripts and managed to transform them into second-rate entertainment like The Cotton Club , Gardens of Stone , and Peggy Sue Got Married . (Coppola, who had been notorious for delivering his own movies late and over budget, earned a reputation as a reliable director.

In the late '70s, he cemented his reputation as an Artist with Apocalypse Now . He gave himself a nervous breakdown, gave Martin Sheen a heart attack, and spent $16 million of his own money to complete the picture.

Casting about for something nice to say, most reviewers have hit upon the conclusion that J.G.'s The Rainmaker is better than the "typical" Hollywood movie (by which they mean it has fewer automatic weapons, fewer car chases, and more character actors than regular fare does).
This vision of Coppola as romantic genius makes it very easy to rationalize his failures as poor accountancy.
So of course he became a hired gun: He needed to pay his debts.
So of course he became a hired gun: He needed to pay his debts.
